result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan P Driscoll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 3 days served.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.   

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 450.11(7)(h), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 3 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, at a rate of $100.00 monthly, commencing March 1st and the 1st of each monthly until paid in full or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Adam Essling for attorney Michael John Steinle.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has tested negative and completed 12 1/2 hours of community service.  State is requesting documentation with dates of testing.  Review hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
On motion of the State, with no objection from defense counsel, Court orders defendant not to use or possess any weapons
Review hearing scheduled for 09-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 12 for BRANCH 3:

Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant sworn as to his statements.

As to Count 5:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and WITHHOLDS entry of judgment of conviction into the record.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing.  Case adjourned for review hearing before Judge Brostrom, Branch 06, per Chief Judge Directive.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  State has offered the defendant a DPA.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 7/9/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Adam Essling for attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  State has turned over all discovery to defense counsel.  Defendant to have a TAD assessment.  State will provide a offer before the next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.A. Medical Center; except to contest job status with attorney or union rep.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ryan P Driscoll in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3-27-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
